phrases.text: Ba lý tang tình mà nghe ta hò ba lý tình tang ba lý tình tang

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "hò" - work song - sung while laboring (rowing, farming, etc.). Work songs from Central and Southern Vietnam, sung during communal labor.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice
Often featured call-and-response between workers to maintain rhythm
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This onomatopoeia phrase contains 16 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. Onomatopoetic phrases use repeated notes or simple patterns to imitate sounds. Strong rhythmic foundation matching physical work movements.
